intro: Lachenalia punctata, commonly known as the spotted lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers during the summer months. It is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and requires full sun to thrive. Lachenalia punctata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
